title: Chelsea 'tracking midfielder Ruslan Malinovskyi with Claude Makelele recommending the Atalanta man'
text:
Chelsea are interested in signing Atlanta midfielder Ruslan Malinovskyi following a recommendation from a club legend.

According to Sportarena.com, the Premier League club have set their sights on the 26-year-old who only joined the Italian side in the summer.

The Ukrainian was reported to be brought to Chelsea's attention by former player Claude Makelele.

Ruslan Malinovskyi (right) has gained attention after starring for both club and country

Starting his club career in Shakhtar Donetsk, Malinovskyi was sent out on loan to Genk where he impressed the Belgian club enough to later join on a full transfer.

While competing in the Belgian Pro League he scored 23 goals in 93 appearances and was a crucial part in them winning the league in the 2018/19 season.

Malinovskyi then joined Atlanta for €13.7m and so far this season has made eight appearances for the club across the Serie A and Champions League.

Ruslan Malinovskyi (left) has been recommended to Chelsea by club legend Claude Makelele

However it is on international duty where he has impressed the most, scoring both goals in a 2-0 win over Lithuania and also shining in their 2-1 win over Portugal.

Should Chelsea make a move, the club would be hoping that the Ukrainian's defensive capabilities and hard work ethic match that of Makelele.

Makelele was a star in Chelsea's midfield for five seasons between 2003 and 2008, winning two Premier League titles.

The Frenchman rejoined the Blues in August 2019 in a coaching capacity.
description: Chelsea are reported to be interested in the Atlanta midfielder after impressing for both club and country. Claude Makelele has brought up the Ukrainian's name to his former side as a possible signing.
